title: Documentation - Method: projects.operations.list
abstract:
# Documentation - Method: projects.operations.list
Lists operations that match the specified filter in the request. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `UNIMPLEMENTED` .
NOTE: the `name` binding allows API services to override the binding to use different resource name schemes, such as `users/*/operations` . To override the binding, API services can add a binding such as `"/v1/{name=users/*}/operations"` to their service configuration. For backwards compatibility, the default name includes the operations collection id, however overriding users must ensure the name binding is the parent resource, without the operations collection id.
#
content:
## HTTP request`GET https://{TRANSLATION_GDCH_ENDPOINT}/v3/{name}/operations`
### Path parameters| Parameters | Parameters.1          |
|:-------------|:----------------------------------------------------|
| name   | string The name of the operation's parent resource. |
### Query parameters| Parameters | Parameters.1       |
|:-------------|:-------------------------------------|
| filter  | string The standard list filter.  |
| page_size | integer The standard list page size. |
| page_token | string The standard list page token. |
### Request bodyThe request body must be empty.
### Response bodyIf successful, the response body contains data with the following structure:The response message for `Operations.ListOperations` .| JSON representation               |
|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| { "operations": [ { object (Operation) } ], "next_page_token": string } || Fields   | Fields.1                     |
|:----------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| operations[] | object (Operation) A list of operations that matches the specified filter in the request. |
| next_page_token | string The standard List next-page token.             |
